data.title: Clarence Byron Weihrauch---October 17, 1943-June 13, 2019
data.text:
On June 13, Clarence Byron Weihrauch went to be with his Lord at the age of 75, surrounded by family. Byron was born on Oct. 17, 1943 to Clarence Edward and Doris (Shadley) Weihrauch.

Byron married Janice Oberly on 7/5/1966 and they were divorced in 1977. They had 3 sons who all survive, Jeffery (Holly) Weihrauch, Michael âMikeâ (Michelle) Weihrauch, and Stephen âSteveâ (Annie) Weihrauch. He married Annette âAJâ Stewart-Shafer on May 2, 1980 and she had two sons, Eric (Judy) Shafer, and Jeffrey âJeffâ Shafer, and they all survive.

Byron graduated from Ada High School in 1966 where he played football, ran track and was active in FFA. He served in the U.S. Army from 1965 â 1967 where he was stationed in Germany and was a Military Police and Motor Sargent. He was discharged in 1967 as an E5. Byron retired from Cooper Tire and Rubber Co. after 35 years in 2002, where he was a Senior Mold Technician, and was Employee of the Year in 1987. After retirement, Byron and AJ moved to Tombstone, AZ in 2007.

Byron coached little league baseball for several years and was a member of many clubs and organizations. Some include: President of the Menâs Bowling Assoc., Master at Liberty Grange, a member of Ada United Methodist Church where he taught Sunday school, was a trustee and served on the financial board, Chairman of the Board of Directors for Millstream Area Credit Union, Chairman of the Board of Directors for Tombstone Federal Credit Union, a member of the Tombstone Community Church where he was a trustee and served on the council, and was an active member of the Tombstone American Legion.

May 15, 2018 was declared as Byron Weihrauch Day by Mayor Dustin Escapule for Byronâs commitment, service and dedication to the Tombstone Community Foodbank, where he served as Vice-President.

Byron is survived by one brother and three sisters, Ronald (Martha) Weihrauch, Donna (Virgil) Campbell, Anita (Steve) Walters, and Debra (Jeffery) Young. He was preceded in death by brother-in-law Steve Walters. Also surviving are 8 grandchildren, Anthony (Kera) Weihrauch, Logan (Crystal) Weihrauch, Brendan Shafer, Corey Shafer, Grant Weihrauch, and Camryn Weihrauch. Byron also had two great grandchildren, and many nieces and nephews.

Byron greatly loved spending time with his grandchildren and attending their sporting events. He enjoyed woodworking projects, and bred, raised and trained reining horses for many years. Byron found great joy in helping others, and will be a great loss to his family and his community.

A memorial service will be led at Tombstone Community Church on July 6 at 1:00pm. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Tombstone Community Foodbank and Valor Hospice Care.
